snippet.title: For sale: Latest inner city pads to hit the market - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
Inner city homes for Herald SUn realestate [04AUG17]
WHETHER you're on the hunt for an inner city pad, or are just fancy taking a peek at some of the latest properties to hit the market, one of these beauties could snag your attention. From Fitzroy to Flemington to South Melbourne there's something out there for everyone. Take a look for yourself.
9 Erskine St, North Melbourne
Moments from Royal Park, this two-bedroom, one-bathroom Victorian presents the perfect opportunity to get into the inner city market. The house has two outdoor areas, a living room, dining and kitchen area as well as laundry facilities in the bathroom. Trevor Gange, of Jellis Craig, is sending the property under the hammer at 2.30pm, August 26. It has a price guide of $900,000 to $950,000.
7 Little Tribe St, South Melbourne.
With three bedrooms and two bathrooms, this house is the perfect inner city family home. The house has a dining, living and kitchen area that flows to a rear deck on the ground floor, while the bedrooms and bathrooms occupy the upper level. Warwick Gardiner, of Greg Hocking, has listed the property with a price guide of $1.5-$1.6 million. It is heading to auction at 12.30pm on August 26.
190 Johnston St, Fitzroy.
This charming property offers a rare combination of a super central location that comes with off-street parking. The house itself has two bedrooms at the front of the property, a study nook, attic storage and a living and kitchen area. It also comes with permits for a three-bedroom, two-bathroom extension. Philip Webb's Leyden Burdett, is sending the property under the hammer at 11am, August 26, with price hopes of $980,000 to $1.07 million.
